Interface Inventory

All Known Implementing Classes:
ABCRentals
public interface Inventory

An abstraction of an inventory system.

Version:
Summer 2010
Author:
Franklin University

Field Summary
static int MAX_ITEMS
          The maximum number of items that an inventory can have.

Field Detail

MAX_ITEMS

static final int MAX_ITEMS
The maximum number of items that an inventory can have.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

add

boolean add(Item item)
Add an item to the inventory. The parameter item should not be something already in the inventory. As a result of adding an item, the item will be assigned an ID starting with 1 and increasing by 1 for each item added. IDs are not reused. All items are kept in a database internal to the inventory so that they may be searched for using a query.

Parameters:
item - the item to add.
Returns:
true when the item is added, false if the item cannot be added for any reason.

findItems

Item[] findItems(Lookup query)
Create and return an array of items that match the given query criteria. The query will identify which items match. The length of the returned array should be equal to the number of items that match, and each element in the array should be a matching item.

Parameters:
query - a query indicating which items to find
Returns:
an array of matching items.

getItemCount

int getItemCount()
Return the number of items presently in inventory.

Returns:
the number of items.

remove

boolean remove(java.lang.String id)
Remove an item. The parameter item should be an item in the inventory. The specified item is located in the database and removed.

Parameters:
id - the id of the item to remove.
Returns:
true if the item was found and removed, false otherwise.
